Author: wl#4107
Content: @jl777c I don't know if you heard about PoolTogether (www.pooltogether.us), but I think it's an awesome Idea and would fit perfectly with Komodo, giving everyone ("the small people") a chance to win without losing....

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
yes someone can build this using tokens (as the lottery ticket) and locking up KMD for monthly rewards.
lock up 30x1000KMD for a daily 5KMD prize of the rewards claim.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: the winner can be selected randomly from the transactions of issuing the lottery tickets.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: I am going to advise against any lottery tied to mainchain

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: It’s just a quagmire in pretty much every country unless done through a NPO, and even then there are restrictions

Author: wl#4107
Content: I thought it'd be a good idea because of the -no losing- part, there are no risks involved, therefore it wouldn't present a risk as any of the traditional lotteries...

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Chance consideration and prize make a lottery .  While you “win” your money back, you had to front up the DAI ( in the pooltogether example ) first.  That would be consideration.

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: Not against games just warning against potential missteps that may occur,  it is a good idea though just needs to be thought of how to be done legally ,  if you were unaware decred is facing some issue because of their staking system because it is somewhat like a lottery.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: html games, 100k budget, no lottery, just games

Author: bartwr#6773
Content:
@jspook16 You asked: Is Beam be compatible with mm2 swaps? 

> Beam needs to be BTC-compatible, understand API calls like `senddrawtransaction`, `gettxout` and so on...
> Or a dev needs to make Beam work with mm2
> Also it has to have (something like) BIP65 implemented

You can maybe check this with a Beam developer.

https://docs.komodoplatform.com/mmV1/coin-integration/coin-integration.html#barterdex-is-officially-deprecated-as-of-this-writing-and-mm2-is-under-testing-before-public-release

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: Hey @jl777c what do you think will be the biggest application for blockchain? Whether it would be currency, IoT, oracles, or something else entirely. What do you see as Komodo's greatest area of opportunity, and do you think the Komodo of today is well positioned to succeed there?

Author: Instel7#1416
Content: @Regnar I bet on games 🤓

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: I think you may be right!

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: *transactions* -  by software/machines, bots, games, voting etc.    anything with an invoice or line item, any exchange.  it's the monetization of the web, digital assets & tokens.   from the abacus with roman numerals that couldn't do division, to the change to the hindu-arabic number system & double entry accounting that is about 430 years old.   blockchain's first application was bitcoin currency, like email to the web.   now streaming vids - in the future streaming payments.

Author: actionslacks#4072
Content: it's an intrinsicly superior system for so many applications. It is a complete certainty to me that any digitally distributed system where trust is necessary to operate can and will be replaced by trustless tech because it's faster, cheaper, and better.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: @kolo

note sure if this helps.
on KMD and any assetchain if you send the coins the the official null priv key burn address the coins are removed from the circ. supply.

Author: kolo#1111
Content: In btc miners when constructing coinbase tx are allowed to not account txfees at all, so this satoshis (10+ btc according article) disappear. It’s interesting, first of all and also can break some system relaying in fact supply never decreases.

Author: kolo#1111
Content: I have huge theoretical interest, because supply never decreases, and unspendable address is just one more existing input, which will never be spent, not that interesting 🙂
